title: tidylaslog
text: tidylaslog provides tools reading, parsing, indexing, exporting LAS (Log ASCII Standard) well log files tidy, analysis-ready tabular formats. workflow designed folder-based LAS collections file contains header metadata (e.g., API county) depth-indexed log curves (e.g., GR, RHOB, NPHI). FAIR-style index first built across LAS directory (index_laslogs()), enabling fast discovery available wells curves. Wells can selected metadata curve availability (select_laslogs()), log data pulled selected wells (pull_laslogs()), returning either wide (machine-learning ready) long (tidy) formats. end--end reproducibility, tidylaslog() batch_export_laslogs() can index, filter, pull, export logs CSV /Parquet one call, optional index tables manifest provenance tracking.

title: tidylaslog
text: approach appropriate large LAS collections rarely analysis-ready raw state: wells vary header completeness, curve availability, naming conventions. directory-level index makes collection searchable reproducible, supports transparent filtering decisions (e.g., keep wells county wells containing GR), avoids repeatedly re-reading full dataset. Returning long wide representations supports complementary workflows: long format tidy analysis/visualization wide format modeling machine learning. Exporting CSV/Parquet enables scalable downstream use earth science, statistics, ML pipelines preserving tidy data principles (Wickham, 2014).

title: tidylaslog
text: Pointed tidylaslog directory containing .las files Built index (index_laslogs()) summarize wells, curves, provenance Inspected available curves (available_curves()) Selected wells using county curve criteria (select_laslogs()) Pulled stacked log data selected APIs (pull_laslogs()), wide long format Exported tables CSV /Parquet (write_laslogs() export mode via tidylaslog() / batch_export_laslogs())
code: knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE)

title: tidylaslog
text: Example 1: Directory workflow (index → select → pull) 1) Directory path (real data) Build index (FAIR-style) curves exist collection? Select wells metadata curve availability Example: keep wells Columbiana County least one GR/RHOB. Pull logs selected wells (wide long) Wide format (ML/spreadsheet-ready): Long format (tidy): QC Number files / wells Missingness summary (wide table) Export (CSV /Parquet) Example 2: One-call pipeline (index + filter + export) Example 3: Universal entry point (tidylaslog)
code: library(tidylaslog) library(dplyr) dir <- "~/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columbiana_wells/Las_new" # stopifnot(dir.exists(dir))  # uncomment when running on your machine dir ## [1] "~/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columbiana_wells/Las_new" idx <- index_laslogs(dir) names(idx) ## [1] "wells_index"  "curves_index" "files_index" # Preview index tables dplyr::glimpse(idx$wells_index) ## Rows: 20 ## Columns: 11 ## $ api         <chr> "34019202560000", "34019202860000", "34019204460000", "340… ## $ uwi         <chr> "34019202560000", "34019202860000", "34019204460000", "340… ## $ county      <chr> "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CA… ## $ state       <chr> "OH", "OHIO", "OH", "OH", "OH", "OH", "OH", "OH", "OH", "O… ## $ latitude    <dbl> 40.71608, 40.65772, 40.61004, 40.61121, 40.60654, 40.58934… ## $ longitude   <dbl> -81.40730, -81.10764, -81.24135, -81.30859, -80.98532, -81… ## $ well        <chr> "#4-455", "#1", "#3", "#4", "#1", "#1", "COMM", "#1", "#1-… ## $ company     <chr> "#15", "INCORPORATED", "LTD", "#10A", "CORP.", "GAS", "COM… ## $ null_value  <dbl> -999.25, -999.25, -999.25, -999.25, -999.25, -999.25, -999… ## $ source_file <chr> "34019202560000.las", "34019202860000.las", "3401920446000… ## $ file_path   <chr> "/home/hxo76/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columb… dplyr::glimpse(idx$curves_index) ## Rows: 130 ## Columns: 8 ## $ api         <chr> "34019202560000", "34019202560000", "34019202560000", "340… ## $ county      <chr> "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CARROLL", "CA… ## $ source_file <chr> "34019202560000.las", "34019202560000.las", "3401920256000… ## $ file_path   <chr> "/home/hxo76/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columb… ## $ MNEM        <chr> "DEPT", "RHOB", "FDC", "GR", "NEUT", "DEPT", "GR", "RHOB",… ## $ UNIT        <chr> "FT", "", "", "", "N", "FT", "", "G/C3", "IN", "FT", "", "… ## $ API_CODE    <chr> "", ".G/C3", ".CPS 42 350 01 01", ".GAPI 35 310 01 01", "3… ## $ DESC        <chr> "Depth in Feet", "Bulk Density", "", "Gamma Ray", "Neutron… dplyr::glimpse(idx$files_index) ## Rows: 20 ## Columns: 3 ## $ api         <chr> "34019202560000", "34019202860000", "34019204460000", "340… ## $ file_path   <chr> "/home/hxo76/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columb… ## $ source_file <chr> "34019202560000.las", "34019202860000.las", "3401920446000… available_curves(idx, top_n = 20) ## # A tibble: 20 × 2 ##    MNEM      n ##    <chr> <int> ##  1 DEPT     20 ##  2 GR       19 ##  3 RHOB     17 ##  4 CALI     12 ##  5 NEUT      7 ##  6 NPHI      6 ##  7 DPHI      3 ##  8 DPOR      2 ##  9 ILD       2 ## 10 PEF       2 ## 11 AVOL      1 ## 12 BIT       1 ## 13 CAL       1 ## 14 CLDC      1 ## 15 DCOR      1 ## 16 DDLL      1 ## 17 DEN       1 ## 18 DOL       1 ## 19 DPRD      1 ## 20 DPRL      1 apis <- select_laslogs(   index = idx,   county = c("COLUMBIANA"),   curves_any = c("GR", "RHOB") )  length(apis) ## [1] 5 head(apis) ## [1] "34029206070000" "34029206560000" "34029206680000" "34029214760000" ## [5] "34029216370000" logs_wide <- pull_laslogs(   index  = idx,   apis   = apis,   curves = c("GR", "RHOB"),   output = "wide" ) dplyr::glimpse(logs_wide) ## Rows: 74,105 ## Columns: 8 ## $ api         <chr> "34029206070000", "34029206070000", "34029206070000", "340… ## $ county      <chr> "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "C… ## $ latitude    <dbl> 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508… ## $ longitude   <dbl> -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80… ## $ source_file <chr> "34029206070000.las", "34029206070000.las", "3402920607000… ## $ depth       <dbl> 500.0, 500.5, 501.0, 501.5, 502.0, 502.5, 503.0, 503.5, 50… ## $ GR          <dbl> 72.21116, 72.21116, 74.20319, 75.19920, 76.19522, 76.19522… ## $ RHOB        <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA… logs_long <- pull_laslogs(   index  = idx,   apis   = apis,   curves = c("GR", "RHOB"),   output = "long" ) dplyr::glimpse(logs_long) ## Rows: 146,809 ## Columns: 8 ## $ api         <chr> "34029206070000", "34029206070000", "34029206070000", "340… ## $ county      <chr> "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "COLUMBIANA", "C… ## $ latitude    <dbl> 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508, 40.78508… ## $ longitude   <dbl> -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80.85105, -80… ## $ source_file <chr> "34029206070000.las", "34029206070000.las", "3402920607000… ## $ depth       <dbl> 500.0, 500.0, 500.5, 500.5, 501.0, 501.0, 501.5, 501.5, 50… ## $ mnemonic    <chr> "GR", "RHOB", "GR", "RHOB", "GR", "RHOB", "GR", "RHOB", "G… ## $ value       <dbl> 72.21116, NA, 72.21116, NA, 74.20319, NA, 75.19920, NA, 76… n_files <- nrow(idx$files_index) n_wells <- nrow(idx$wells_index)  n_files ## [1] 20 n_wells ## [1] 20 missing_pct <- sapply(logs_wide, function(x) mean(is.na(x)) * 100)  missing_summary <- tibble(   variable = names(missing_pct),   missing_percent = as.numeric(missing_pct) ) %>%   arrange(desc(missing_percent))  head(missing_summary, 20) ## # A tibble: 8 × 2 ##   variable    missing_percent ##   <chr>                 <dbl> ## 1 RHOB                  52.9  ## 2 GR                     7.88 ## 3 api                    0    ## 4 county                 0    ## 5 latitude               0    ## 6 longitude              0    ## 7 source_file            0    ## 8 depth                  0 out_dir <- file.path(dir, "exports_tidylaslog") dir.create(out_dir, showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)  paths <- write_laslogs(   data    = logs_wide,   out_dir = out_dir,   prefix  = "columbiana_GR_RHOB_wide",   csv     = TRUE,   parquet = FALSE   # set TRUE if arrow is installed )  paths ## $csv ## [1] "/home/hxo76/CSE_MSE_RXF131/staging/sdle/geospatial/Columbiana_wells/Las_new/exports_tidylaslog/columbiana_GR_RHOB_wide.csv" ##  ## $parquet ## NULL res <- batch_export_laslogs(   dir = dir,   out_dir = out_dir,   county = c("COLUMBIANA"),   curves_any = c("GR", "RHOB"),   output = "wide",   csv = TRUE,   parquet = FALSE,   write_index = TRUE )  names(res) ## [1] "index"       "apis"        "data"        "paths"       "index_paths" ## [6] "manifest" res2 <- tidylaslog(   x = dir,   county = c("COLUMBIANA"),   curves_any = c("GR"),   output = "wide",   out_dir = out_dir,   formats = "csv",   write_index = TRUE,   manifest = TRUE )  names(res2) ## [1] "index"       "apis"        "data"        "paths"       "index_paths" ## [6] "manifest"

title: tidylaslog
text: Parses well log files Log ASCII Standard (LAS) format (commonly used petrophysics geoscience) returns tidy R data structures.

code: available_curves(index, county = NULL, top_n = NULL)

title: List available curve mnemonics in an index — available_curves
text: index Output index_laslogs() county Optional county filter (character vector) top_n NULL, return top N common curves

title: List available curve mnemonics in an index — available_curves
text: Tibble MNEM n (count wells containing curve)

title: List available curve mnemonics in an index — available_curves
code: td <- tempdir() f <- file.path(td, "a.las")  las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0:",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000:",   " STOP.M 1001:",   " STEP.M 1:",   " NULL. -999.25:",   " API . 1111111111:",   " CNTY. TEST:",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M:",   " GR.API:",   " RHOB.G/C3:",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80 2.35",   " 1001 82 2.36" )  writeLines(las_text, f) idx <- index_laslogs(td) available_curves(idx, top_n = 5) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   MNEM            n #>   <chr>       <int> #> 1 DEPT            1 #> 2 GR              1 #> 3 INFORMATION     1 #> 4 RHOB            1

what: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
title: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
text: Index, filter, pull, export LAS logs one call

title: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
code: batch_export_laslogs(   dir,   out_dir,   county = NULL,   curves_any = NULL,   curves_all = NULL,   curves = NULL,   output = c("wide", "long"),   prefix = NULL,   csv = TRUE,   parquet = TRUE,   write_index = TRUE,   index_prefix = NULL )

title: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
text: dir Folder containing .las files out_dir Output directory (absolute path, relative dir) county Optional county filter (character vector) curves_any Optional: keep wells least one curves curves_all Optional: keep wells curves curves Optional: curves actually export (defaults curves_all, else curves_any, else NULL=) output "wide" "long" prefix Optional file prefix. NULL, informative prefix built. csv Write CSV? parquet Write Parquet? write_index TRUE, also export wells_index/curves_index/files_index tables index_prefix Optional prefix index files (defaults prefix__index)

title: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
text: Invisibly returns list index, apis, data, output paths, manifest

title: Index, filter, pull, and export LAS logs in one call — batch_export_laslogs
code: td <- tempdir() f <- file.path(td, "a.las")  las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0:",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000:",   " STOP.M 1001:",   " STEP.M 1:",   " NULL. -999.25:",   " API . 1111111111:",   " CNTY. TEST:",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M:",   " GR.API:",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82" )  writeLines(las_text, f)  res <- batch_export_laslogs(   dir = td,   out_dir = file.path(td, "exports"),   county = "TEST",   curves_any = "GR",   output = "wide",   csv = TRUE,   parquet = FALSE,   write_index = TRUE ) names(res) #> [1] "index"       "apis"        "data"        "paths"       "index_paths" #> [6] "manifest"

title: Build a FAIR index for a folder of LAS files — index_laslogs
code: td <- tempdir() f1 <- file.path(td, "a.las") f2 <- file.path(td, "b.las")  las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0:",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000:",   " STOP.M 1001:",   " STEP.M 1:",   " NULL. -999.25:",   " API . 1111111111:",   " CNTY. TEST:",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M:",   " GR.API:",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82" )  writeLines(las_text, f1) writeLines(sub("1111111111", "2222222222", las_text), f2)  idx <- index_laslogs(td) names(idx) #> [1] "wells_index"  "curves_index" "files_index"

title: Pull log data for selected wells (optionally selected curves) — pull_laslogs
code: td <- tempdir() f <- file.path(td, "a.las")  las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0:",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000:",   " STOP.M 1001:",   " STEP.M 1:",   " NULL. -999.25:",   " API . 1111111111:",   " CNTY. TEST:",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M:",   " GR.API:",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82" )  writeLines(las_text, f) idx <- index_laslogs(td) dat <- pull_laslogs(idx, apis = "1111111111", curves = "GR", output = "long") head(dat) #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

what: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
text: tidylaslog supports two equivalent representations LAS log data:

title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
code: read_laslog(file, output = c("long", "wide"))

title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
text: file Path .las file output Output format: "wide" One row per depth per well, curves columns (ML- spreadsheet-ready). "long" One row per curve measurement columns depth, mnemonic, value (tidy format).

title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
text: S3 object class "laslog" VERSION/WELL/CURVE/PARAMETER//LOG

title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
text: Wide format: one row per depth step per well, curve stored separate column. Long format: one row per measurement, curve names stored mnemonic column values value column. formats contain information optimized different workflows.

title: Read a LAS well log file (Log ASCII Standard) into a structured object — read_laslog
code: las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0: CWLS LOG ASCII STANDARD",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000: Start depth",   " STOP.M 1002: Stop depth",   " STEP.M 1: Step",   " NULL. -999.25: Null value",   " API . 1111111111: API number",   " CNTY. TEST: County",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M: Depth",   " GR.API: Gamma Ray",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82",   " 1002 79" ) f <- tempfile(fileext = ".las") writeLines(las_text, f) x <- read_laslog(f, output = "long") head(x$LOG) #> # A tibble: 0 × 0

text: file Path .las file

title: Read LAS header only (no ~A data) — read_laslog_header
text: S3 object class "laslog_header" VERSION/WELL/CURVE/PARAMETER/plus provenance

title: Read LAS header only (no ~A data) — read_laslog_header
code: las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0: CWLS LOG ASCII STANDARD",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000: Start depth",   " STOP.M 1001: Stop depth",   " STEP.M 1: Step",   " NULL. -999.25: Null value",   " API . 1111111111: API number",   " CNTY. TEST: County",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M: Depth",   " GR.API: Gamma Ray",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82" ) f <- tempfile(fileext = ".las") writeLines(las_text, f) h <- read_laslog_header(f) names(h) #> [1] "VERSION"     "WELL"        "CURVE"       "PARAMETER"   "OTHER"       #> [6] "null_value"  "source_file"

what: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
text: tidylaslog() works either single LAS file directory LAS files. can return data directly R export analysis-ready tables disk.

title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
code: tidylaslog(   x,   county = NULL,   curves_any = NULL,   curves_all = NULL,   curves = NULL,   output = c("wide", "long"),   out_dir = NULL,   prefix = NULL,   formats = c("csv", "parquet"),   write_index = TRUE,   write_meta = TRUE,   meta_sections = c("VERSION", "WELL", "CURVE", "PARAMETER", "OTHER"),   manifest = TRUE )

title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
text: x Path .las file directory containing .las files. county Optional county filter (directory mode ). curves_any Keep wells contain least one curves (directory mode). curves_all Keep wells contain curves (directory mode). curves Curves actually keep/export. Defaults curves_all, curves_any, otherwise curves. output Output format: "wide" One row per depth per well, curves columns (ML- spreadsheet-ready). "long" One row per curve measurement columns depth, mnemonic, value (tidy format). out_dir NULL, data returned R . provided, outputs written directory. relative (e.g. "exports"), created inside x x directory. prefix Optional filename prefix exported files. formats Output formats write. One "csv" "parquet". write_index Write index tables (wells, curves, files) exporting directories? write_meta Write metadata tables (WELL, CURVE, etc.) single-file exports? meta_sections metadata sections export ("VERSION", "WELL", "CURVE", "PARAMETER", ""). manifest Write JSON manifest describing export?

title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
text: out_dir NULL: Single file S3 object class "laslog" containing VERSION, WELL, CURVE, PARAMETER, , LOG. Directory list index, apis, combined data. out_dir provided: Single file list containing exported data paths, metadata paths, optional manifest. Directory full batch export result (see batch_export_laslogs()).

title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
text: function supports two equivalent representations LAS log data: Wide format: one row per depth step per well, curve stored separate column. Long format: one row per measurement, curve names stored mnemonic column values value column. formats contain information optimized different workflows (machine learning vs tidy analysis).

title: Universal entry point for reading, indexing, and exporting LAS well logs — tidylaslog
code: # ---- Single file mode (return to R) ---- las_text <- c(   " ~Version Information",   " VERS. 2.0:",   " WRAP. NO:",   " ~Well Information",   " STRT.M 1000:",   " STOP.M 1002:",   " STEP.M 1:",   " NULL. -999.25:",   " API . 1111111111:",   " CNTY. TEST:",   " ~Curve Information",   " DEPT.M:",   " GR.API:",   " ~ASCII Log Data",   " 1000 80",   " 1001 82",   " 1002 79" ) f <- tempfile(fileext = ".las") writeLines(las_text, f) obj <- tidylaslog(f, output = "long") head(obj$LOG) #> # A tibble: 0 × 0  # ---- Directory mode (return to R) ---- td <- tempdir() f1 <- file.path(td, "a.las") f2 <- file.path(td, "b.las") writeLines(las_text, f1) writeLines(sub("1111111111", "2222222222", las_text), f2) res <- tidylaslog(td, county = "TEST", curves_any = "GR", output = "wide") names(res) #> [1] "index" "apis"  "data"   # ---- Export mode (CSV only, no arrow needed) ---- out_dir <- file.path(td, "exports_demo") ex <- tidylaslog(td,   county = "TEST",   curves_any = "GR",   output = "wide",   out_dir = out_dir,   formats = "csv",   write_index = TRUE,   manifest = FALSE ) names(ex) #> [1] "index"       "apis"        "data"        "paths"       "index_paths" #> [6] "manifest"

what: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
title: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
text: Write LAS logs CSV /Parquet

title: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
code: write_laslogs(data, out_dir, prefix = "laslogs", csv = TRUE, parquet = TRUE)

title: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
text: data Tibble returned pull_laslogs() out_dir Output directory prefix File prefix (extension) csv Write CSV file? parquet Write Parquet file? (requires arrow)

title: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
text: Invisibly returns output paths

title: Write LAS logs to CSV and/or Parquet — write_laslogs
code: out_dir <- tempdir() df <- data.frame(api = "1111111111", depth = c(1000, 1001), GR = c(80, 82)) paths <- write_laslogs(df, out_dir = out_dir, prefix = "demo", csv = TRUE, parquet = FALSE) paths #> $csv #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpl8Kj5E/demo.csv" #>  #> $parquet #> NULL #>
